description: The CSI 300 Index is now at a five-year low, following three years of market correction. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Stay put or go in? Analysts’ take for S’pore investors in China’s beaten-down equity markets
title_page: Stay put or go in? Analysts’ take for S’pore investors in China’s beaten-down equity markets | The Straits Times
maintext:
SINGAPORE – Chinese markets have extended gains for the fourth straight session on Feb 8 ahead of the week-long Spring Festival break.
The CSI 300 Index, the blue-chip benchmark for the Shanghai and Shenzhen exchanges, has risen 4.5 per cent over the past four days but remains near a five-year low following three years of market correction.
